column5: Have a typical built in Sony Marine Radio for music/ news. Came with the boat.  Turns on and everything but no sound with the radio setting.  Nothing. No matter  how much I crank the volume.   Couple years now.  When I plug in the iPod into the aux port  I get great sound.  I'd like to fix that.  Any idea what I should do?  Thanks. Peter
is it like a car radio??? is there an antenna ??? if not maybe there should be one, check for a jack for an antenna on the unit.
It's like a car radio. It has an antenna and it seems to be hooked up
I guess the next question would be, have you checked to see if there is a separate selection tab or button to switch from the external IPod or Aux. port to just AM or FM?
Is there an inline fuse on the wire that powers the radio?  Check there first.  Any loose wires dangling down behind the radio - such as a ground wire?  Good luck!

How old is the radio? Unfortunately, radios do not last that long in a marine environment with all the moisture. Thankfully, they are fairly cheap these days. A decent unit can be had for 150 bucks or so.
Try contacting these people.  Great to deal with. marine radios fixed and sold.  http://www.danatrading.com/surplus-deals.html
I suspect the attenna to be the culprit. Does the tuner keep searching for a channel?
I suspect the attenna to be the culprit. Does the tuner keep searching for a channel?
Checked all the wires. All solidly connected. The tuner doesn't  search. Not even a bit of static when volume turned up with tuner on. I suspect it's a problem in the unit itself. ?
